result.execSummary:
The defendant Kody F. Boe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Kody F. Boe in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states the parties have reached an agreement - asking for costs-only dispo.  Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence:  Costs, 60 dtp.
Status conference on August 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kody F. Boe in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M states this is her first appearance; enters NG plea on def's behalf, defense having waived formal reading of the complaint; asks for status.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kody F. Boe in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court states the charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights including right to counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
